responses: The Control Panel is your complete system monitoring and control center. It provides: 1) **System Status**: Real-time status of all components 2) **Crop & Soil Configuration**: Set up your agricultural profile 3) **Threshold Control**: Adjust moisture levels 4) **Manual Control**: Direct pump/valve control 5) **Scheduling**: Set irrigation times 6) **Activity Logs**: Track all system actions.

System Status: 1) **Overall**: Online/Offline 2) **ESP32 Connection**: Connected/Disconnected 3) **Operation Mode**: Auto/Manual 4) **Emergency Status**: Active/Inactive 5) **Current Threshold**: {{ systemState.threshold }}% 6) **Last Updated**: Just now. Green indicators mean normal operation, red indicates issues.

To switch operation modes: 1) Click the 'Switch to Manual/Auto' button in System Status card 2) Confirm any prompts 3) System will change mode immediately. **Auto mode** uses smart algorithms, **Manual mode** gives you direct control. Current mode: {{ systemState.systemMode }}.

Crop Configuration: 1) Select from available crops: Banana, Maize, Beans, Coffee, Cassava, Rice, Tomato, Potato, Sugarcane, Vegetables 2) Choose your specific crop type 3) Click 'Save Configuration' 4) System will adjust optimal settings automatically. Current crop: {{ elements.currentCropDisplay.textContent }}.

Soil Configuration: 1) Select soil type: Clay, Loamy, or Sandy 2) Clay retains water longer, Sandy drains faster 3) Choose your actual soil type 4) Click 'Save Configuration' 5) System adjusts watering patterns accordingly. Current soil: {{ elements.currentSoilDisplay.textContent }}.

Threshold Control: 1) Use the slider (0-100%) 2) Click +/- buttons for 5% adjustments 3) Click 'Set Threshold' to apply 4) System will water when moisture drops below this level. Current threshold: {{ systemState.threshold }}%. Use 'Use Recommended Threshold' for optimal settings based on your crop/soil.

Manual Control (available only in Manual mode): 1) Ensure system is in Manual mode 2) Use 'Turn ON/OFF' buttons for Pump and Valve 3) Pump controls water circulation 4) Valve controls water flow 5) Changes take effect immediately. Use for testing or emergency adjustments.

Scheduling Irrigation: 1) Select date and time 2) Set duration (1-120 minutes) 3) Click 'Schedule Irrigation' 4) System will automatically water at scheduled time. Scheduling is only available in Manual mode when no emergency is active. You can view/edit/delete upcoming schedules.

Viewing/Editing Schedules: 1) Scheduled events appear below the scheduling form 2) Each shows date, time, and duration 3) Use edit (pencil) icon to modify 4) Use delete (trash) icon to remove 5) Past events show as completed. Schedules can only be modified in Manual mode without emergency.

Activity Logs: 1) Shows all user actions and system events 2) Timestamped records 3) Color-coded by type (info, warning, error) 4) Auto-updates in real-time 5) Can be exported to CSV for analysis. Logs help track system usage and troubleshoot issues.

Exporting Logs: 1) Click 'Export Logs' button above activity log 2) Confirm export in the popup modal 3) File downloads as CSV format 4) Contains timestamp, type, and message for each entry 5) Useful for record-keeping or analysis.

Emergency Status shows if the system is in emergency shutdown: 1) **Active**: All irrigation stopped, manual controls disabled 2) **Inactive**: Normal operation 3) Displayed in System Status card 4) Requires manual reset to clear. Current status: {{ systemState.emergency ? 'ACTIVE' : 'Inactive' }}.

ESP32 Connection: 1) Shows connectivity to the physical irrigation controller 2) **Connected**: Communication established 3) **Disconnected**: No communication with hardware 4) Checks every 3 seconds 5) Essential for system operation. Current status: {{ systemState.esp32Connected ? 'Connected' : 'Disconnected' }}.

Recommended Settings: 1) Based on crop type and soil composition 2) Click 'Use Recommended Threshold' to apply 3) Automatically calculates optimal moisture levels 4) Varies by crop water needs and soil water retention 5) Displayed as suggestions in threshold control.

Real-time Monitoring: 1) Data updates every 3 seconds 2) Moisture levels show current soil conditions 3) Pump/Valve status shows actual device states 4) Connection status updates continuously 5) All changes reflect immediately in the interface 6) Timestamps show last update time.

patterns: When can I use manual mode?
responses: Manual Mode Requirements: 1) **Available**: When no emergency is active 2) **Switch to Manual**: Use mode toggle button 3) **Features enabled**: Direct pump/valve control, Scheduling 4) **Automatic features disabled**: Smart watering algorithms 5) **Use cases**: Testing, maintenance, specific watering needs.

Auto Mode Features: 1) **Smart watering**: Based on moisture thresholds 2) **Weather consideration**: Adjusts for environmental conditions 3) **Energy efficient**: Optimizes pump usage 4) **Handles all irrigation automatically** 5) **No scheduling required** 6) **Best for most farming operations**.

Control Panel Troubleshooting: 1) **Check connection**: Ensure ESP32 is connected 2) **Refresh page**: Sometimes fixes display issues 3) **Check mode**: Some features only work in Manual mode 4) **Emergency status**: Manual controls disabled during emergency 5) **Log errors**: Check activity logs for error messages 6) **Export logs**: For technical support if issues persist.

Saving Configurations: 1) Always click 'Save Configuration' after changes 2) Settings are stored on the server 3) Persist between sessions 4) Apply to automatic watering calculations 5) Can be exported/backed up through system settings 6: Unsaved changes will be lost on page refresh.

Scheduling Limitations: 1) **Only available in Manual mode** 2) **Disabled during emergencies** 3) **Requires future date/time** 4) **Duration 1-120 minutes only** 5) **Maximum 10 scheduled events** 6) **System must be online at scheduled time**. Check mode and emergency status if scheduling is unavailable.
